Reviews.Title: Product seems nice, limitation is the length of the wires
Reviews.Author: Mh Cliver "abookeworme"
Reviews.Content: Bought it, my installation tech (a good friend) was impressed but we can't use it because my 1930s house would need too many holes drilled through it for this to reach.  UNIMPRESSED by Hossen, the seller - am trying to resell the one I bought (brand new, still in box) otherwise will have to send it back and wait months for a refund.  STRONGLY SUGGEST you buy something from the same country you live in...

Reviews.Title: good picture. nothing to do with 2.4Ghz.
Reviews.Author: E.E.E. "EEE"
Reviews.Content: positives:1.very nice and stylish2.good picture quality3.operation and adjustments4.sounds5.night view with no lightsnegatives:1.nothing to do with wireless 2.4Ghz as on picture2.outside camera is bulky3.outside camera has 90* angle view, creates black(uncovered) zones4.no adjustable view bracket for outside camera5.needs  professional  installationwhat and how I did:My first attempt was to send it back, since it wasn't wireless. then I assemble it on a table and picture quality, and size convicted me to try to install. the main problem is camera , it's 90* angle is completely unacceptable neither  the unit is placed on a wall next to the door nor on the door itself. I did a metal box, put it on a wall next to the door, then I put camera inside the box at 45* so one side of camera angle view was along the wall. more than that: the metal box at 4ft height and turned a little up so if the stranger wearing hood and look down the camera shuts right in a face. regarding inside units to feed them the power outlet should be around I took electricity from a switch and all the wires put inside the wall ( look at the picture). So since everybody has its own location and to have it nice professional installation needed. The unit is good.All the best. :)
